paper_abstract: We consider a random walk (Zn-(1),...,Zn(K+1)) epsilon Z(K+1) with the constraint that each coordinate of the walk is at distance one from the following one. In this paper, we show that this random walk is slowed down by a variance factor sigma(2)(K)=2K+2 with respect to the case of the classical simple random walk without constraint. (c) 2014 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 47, 267-283, 2015
paper_title: Diffusivity of a random walk on random walks
